messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I'm OK
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/11/03 1:57:48 PM Eastern Daylight Time, mc1mommy@aol.com ... My boys do that.  I hear the I m OK and I respond That s good . Pam G.
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/11/03 1:57:48 PM Eastern Daylight Time, mc1mommy@...
writes:

>
>
>
> I'm in the front room playing on the computer; my son is at the kitchen
> table playing with playdough. I hear a loud crash. Does he run upstairs
> to
> hide? Does he yell out, "I didn't do it!"? Nope. He yells out, "I'm OK!"
>

My boys do that. I hear the "I'm OK" and I respond "That's good ".
Pam G.

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] I'm OK
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/11/03 1:57:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time, mc1mommy@aol.com ... there s a running joke in our family from It s a Wonderful Life , when Uncle
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/11/03 1:57:17 PM Eastern Daylight Time, mc1mommy@...
writes:

> He yells out, "I'm OK!"
>

there's a running joke in our family from "It's a Wonderful Life", when Uncle
Billy stumbles drunk down the sidewalk and crashed into something off-screen
very loudly, and shouts "I'm ALRIGHT! I'm alright...." so when ever someone
crashes around the house, that's what we yell LOL

Ang


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: I'm OK
messages.msgSnippet: I m in the front room playing on the computer; my son is at the kitchen table playing with playdough.  I hear a loud crash.  Does he run upstairs to hide?
messages.messageBody:
I'm in the front room playing on the computer; my son is at the kitchen
table playing with playdough. I hear a loud crash. Does he run upstairs to
hide? Does he yell out, "I didn't do it!"? Nope. He yells out, "I'm OK!"
(One less dish I have to wash.)
Mary J
